inclusion.criterion: Patients ≥65 years-old diagnosed with severe AS (defined as: jet velocity ≥ 4.0 m/s or mean gradient ≥ 40 mmHg or velocity ratio <0.25 AND aortic valve area ≤ 1.0 cm2 or aortic valve area index ≤ 0.6 cm2/m2; OR mean gradient >30 mmHg AND aortic valve area ≤ 1.0 cm2 or aortic valve area index ≤ 0.6 cm2/m2 AND >1200 Agatston units for women or >2000 Agatston units for men as determined by non-contrast CT).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Small aortic annulus defined as a mean aortic annulus diameters ˂22 mm as measured by 3D-computed tomography (CT) and/or 3D-transesophageal echocardiography (TEE).
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Prohibitive surgical risk as determined by the Heart Team
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Coronary artery disease (CAD) not treatable by percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) or coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), or SYNTAX score >32 (in the absence of prior revascularization)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has severe AS, small aortic annulus, and no prohibitive surgical risk or dialysis-dependency. However, coronary artery disease is not treatable by PCI or CABG.
